intro: Malvastrum fasciculatum var. nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces clusters of pink to purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid and semi-arid environments. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Nuttall's mallow is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its showy blooms.
